snippet: Express Scripts says that nearly half the people who took opioids for more than 30 days in the study’s first year were still using them three years later.
abstract: Pharmacy benefits manager Express Scripts report finds almost half of people who took potentially addictive narcotic painkillers for more than 30 days in study's first year are still using them three years later; study looked at claims of 6.8 million Americans filling at least one opioid prescription between 2009 and 2013.
lead_paragraph: Express Scripts says that nearly half the people who took opioids for more than 30 days in the study’s first year were still using them three years later.
